snippet: Jean-Marie Le Pen, who co-founded the National Front, was excluded on Thursday from the party following a disciplinary hearing.
abstract: Executive board of France's far-right National Front expels co-founder Jean-Marie Le Pen; decision follows months-long public feud between Le Pen and his daughter Marine, who is current party leader, that came to virulent head following embarrassing remarks by the senior Le Pen about the Holocaust.

byline.contributor: Lilia Blaise and Elian Peltier contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Jean-Marie Le Pen, who co-founded the National Front, was excluded on Thursday from the party following a disciplinary hearing.

headline.main: Jean-Marie Le Pen, Co-Founder of National Front, Is Ousted From French Far-Right Party
headline.print_headline: French Far-Right Party Expels a Founder
